The 'Russian Air Force' () is the aerial warfare service branch of the Armed
Forces of the Russian Federation. It is currently under the command of
Lieutenant General Viktor Bondarev. The Russian Navy has its own air arm, the
Russian Naval Aviation, which is the former Soviet Aviatsiya Voyenno Morskogo
Flota ("Naval Aviation"), or AV-MF).

The Air Force was formed from parts of the former Soviet Air Forces after the
dissolution of the Soviet Union in 1991â92. Boris Yeltsin's creation of the
Ministry of Defence of the Russian Federation on 7 May 1992, can be taken as a
convenient formation date for the new Air Force. Since that time, the Air Force
has suffered severe setbacks due to lack of resources, and has constantly shrunk
in size. Since Vladimir Putin became President of the Russian Federation
however, much more money has been allocated to the Armed Forces as a whole.
